page.title: 08PADBURY AND HILLESDEN FARMS
page.content: The majority of the land between the villages is owned by 3 distinct land owners, though there are some small privately owned farms. Several farms are worked by tenants on behalf of All Souls College, Oxford.A group of farms have recently been acquired by a business consortium and are run by managers. The third group are owned by a local farmer who is a generous benefactor to the local community. The land is approximately two thirds arable and one third grazing. The main crops are wheat, barley and oilseed rape. The grazing is used for sheep and cattle, mainly Herefords, Shorthorns and Jerseys. Some of the grassland is reputed not to have been under the plough since the Enclosures Act and signs of strip cultivation can still be seen particularly to the north and west of Padbury.
